answers.author: John Garvison
answers.text:
Try www.acypl.org They send young elected officials on quasi-diplomatic missions to countries around the world. I was sent to Israel/Palestinian Territories in 2005 and made contacts with politicians from that part of the world.
They have an extensive alumni network and they may be able to provide some assistance in this area. I hope this helps, and have a safe trip!

answers.author: Peter Agh
answers.text:
Hi Leland!
I am currently the vice-pres of Slovakian City Managers Assoc. for int'l contacts, also vice-chair of the Int'l committee of ICMA. If he would be interested in central Europe (Czech rep., Slovakia, Austria or Hungary) I might be able to help to set up contacts. Poland has no such position as the CM, but there are some possibilities with mayors as well. Write to me directly if you want @ peter.agh@novezamky.sk
Peter

Peter

answers.author: Ross Hoff
answers.text:
ICMA is affiliated with the European Federation of Local Government Chief Executives (UDiTE is the acronym of the organization's French name):  http://www.udite.eu.    UDiTE's current president is ICMA member Bryon Davies (Byron@udite.eu), who would likely have suggestions for good contacts.   It will help him to know which countries the mayor plans to visit.

answers.author: Ståle Stormark
answers.text:
Dear Leland!
I am a former city manager from Norway and former President of the Norwegian Forum of Municipal (Chief) Executives. These days I am an International member of ICMA, and also working on a international comparative study of the City Manager profession and the CM Associations' work to develop and promote the role and profession. I would be happy to try to help set up a program in Scandinavia, if that is of interest. If so, please write me directly at stale.stormark@hotmail.com.  
Best regards,
Ståle

Best regards,

Ståle

author: Leland Walton
text:
I have a mayor traveling to Europe later this year who would like potential contacts with municipal officals. His purpose is presumably to learn and perhaps exchange ideas and information. Any ideas or suggestions how to make such arrangements? Apparentl;y NLC was not much help.
Lee Walton.
title: Foreign contacts
